bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 159 (Friday, September 29, 2023)][House][Pages H4911-H4912]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. OGLES:H.R. 5853.[[Page H4912]]Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section VIII of the United States ConstitutionThe single subject of this legislation is:To provide that Members of Congress may not receive payafter October 1 of any fiscal year in which Congress has notapproved a concurrent resolution on the budget and passed theregular appropriations bills.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 11.

item.title: Public Safety Officer Concussion and Traumatic Brain Injury Health Act of 2023

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

bill.title: No Budget, No Pay Act

item.title: To provide that Members of Congress may not receive pay after October 1 of any fiscal year in which Congress has not approved a concurrent resolution on the budget and passed the regular appropriations bills.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
